titlestmt.titleproper: Wagner Free Institute of Science closing exercises announcements and programs 1921-1989
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Wagner Free Institute of Science closing exercises announcements and programs

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. The Wagner Free Institute of Science held closing exercises at the end of each academic year to confer certificates of completion on students. Lectures by guest speakers were typically given during the closing exercises. The Institute produced printed announcements and programs of these ceremonies through the 1988-1989 academic year.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of announcements (1936 to 1983, some years missing) and programs (1921 to 1989, some years missing) for the closing exercises of the Wagner Free Institute of Science. The program for the closing exercises lists the Institute's trustees and faculty, the title of the lecture given during the ceremony, and a list of certificates awarded.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
